column4: hello all, ok, so I extract tracks from a CD using sound juicer and want to put them on my ipod with amarok only that the tracks are extracted as .ogg, anyway I can make them into .mp3 in Ubuntu?
hello all, ok, so I extract tracks from a CD using sound juicer and want to put them on my ipod with amarok only that the tracks are extracted as .ogg, anyway I can make them into .mp3 in Ubuntu?
any programme to make .ogg filed into .mp3 in ubuntu?
http://marginalhacks.com/bin/ogg2mp3
uses lame to convert
you can do it from a command-line script, ie ogg2mp3 (Google it)
i don't know any GUI programs to convert ogg files to mp3s off hand
look into soundconverter.  that might be what you want
it uses the gstreamer libraries for lame, i believe
try 'apt-cache search soundconverter'.  if it doesn't return anything you may need another repo in your /etc/apt/sources.list
apt-get install soundconverter
it *should* install the dependencies and you can then run it from the menu
sorry, try 'sudo apt-get install soundconverter'
here's the website for it: http://soundconverter.berlios.de/
with screenshots
it means it broke half way through installing
try 'sudo apt-get install -f'
oh, n/m
that is the debconf dialog for configuring packages, most likely
just another way of configuring stuff
try installing the same package through the Synaptic package installer?
